channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9597] Create hbase-thrift module
item.description:
We should create an hbase-thrift module. Right now if users want to use mapreduce they need to include hbase-server module. That module has waaay too many dependencies. One of the most problematic is thrift.

Users could be using a different version of thrift on mr.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Here's a patch that moves thrift into hbase-thrift module.
The patch is huge but it's pretty much all moves with one change assembly's xml and a new pom.

This right?

+ <directory>$

{project.basedir}

/../hbase-thrift/target/hbase-webapps</directory>
+ <outputDirectory>hbase-webapps/</outputDirectory>
+ <fileMode>0644</fileMode>
+ <directoryMode>0755</directoryMode>

+1 if hadoopqa passes and if it runs on a cluster.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12604272/HBASE-9597-0.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 34 new or modified tests.

-1 hadoop1.0. The patch failed to compile against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7321//console

I had missed a plugin to add the jsp source. Here's the patch that I plan on committing.
Thanks for the review stack
Want to extract out hbase-rest while you're at it?

I thought about it, but I wasn't sure that it would help in removing the dependencies in hbase-server. My thought was that we'll still have jetty for info server and the json stuff is inside of get/result.

I can take a look at it though.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: HBase's thrift server was moved into it's own module. This has removed the dependency for Thrift in the hbase-server module.
